meanings.definition: The belief that everything that will happen has already been decided by God or fate.
meanings.sent1: Some people believe in predestination, thinking that their future is already planned out.
meanings.sent2: The concept of predestination is a common theme in many religious teachings.
meanings.sent3: It's like predestination is a crystal ball showing us what's to come.
meanings.sent4: Her acceptance of predestination was like surrendering to an invisible hand guiding her life.
meanings.sent5: The idea of predestination can be both comforting and unsettling at the same time.

meanings.definition: The action of determining an outcome or course of events in advance.
meanings.sent1: The predestination of the project's success was evident from the detailed planning.
meanings.sent2: They believed in the power of predestination to shape their future endeavors.
meanings.sent3: The predestination of the surprise party was almost ruined by a slip of the tongue.
meanings.sent4: His predestination of the market trends was so accurate, it seemed like magic.
meanings.sent5: The predestination of the chess match was clear as soon as the first move was made.
